data.title: How to hide toolbar in the left?
data.body: Is there a command to hide toolbar?

data.title: C# Arrow functions with string breaking color themes
data.body:
VS Code: 1.4.0

This issue is similar to this one for TS: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3919

But in this case, it's happening in C# after using an arrow function AND the new string format syntax:

`protected string Name(string name) => $"My Name is {name}";`

![vscode-problem-csharp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4261458/17761004/fe29466c-6546-11e6-9108-5bf61b87b063.PNG)

if you remove the curly braces from the string, it's  fine:

`protected string Name(string name) => $"My Name is name";`

![vscode-problem-csharp-working](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4261458/17761147/0c9ad02a-6548-11e6-9ca5-93bf3aced33e.PNG)

data.title: Cannot find file in E drive because of case (looking in e drive)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro, version 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a project in your e drive
2. Build it
3. Run it using node from within VS code
4. Cannot find server.js file

/C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:117 Internal module e%3A%5CRepos%5CAdvent_1%5CReactPrototype%5Cserver.js not found.: Error: Internal module e%3A%5CRepos%5CAdvent_1%5CReactPrototype%5Cserver.js not found.
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:85:1392
    at Object.m [as _notify](file:///C:/Program Files %28x86%29/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:8153)
    at Object.B.enter (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:11658)
    at i.Class.define._run (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:12979)
    at i.Class.define._error (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:12496)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:81:20894
    at t.e.dispatch (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:81:22001)
    at t.e.handleData (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:81:21525)
    at Socket.<anonymous> (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:81:20754)
    at emitOne (events.js:90:13)

It cannot find the file because it is in the E drive, not the e drive. It cannot handle the case. I moved the repo to my C drive and it worked fine.

data.title: Glob matching should be case insensitive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win10 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
1. using VSCode, open a directory stored in an NTFS volume, which has files named FooContainer.cs
2. press CTRL+SHIFT+F to invoke Find in Files
3. press "..." to show 'files to include'
4. enter "*_/_container.cs"
5. search for something that is known to exist in the file.
6. results: nothing is found
7. replace 'files to include' with "*_/_Container.cs" (only change is the upper case C instead of lower case)
8. search again, this time results are found as expected.

Since Windows NTFS is not a case-sensitive file system, the expected results is that I can search in files using any case in the 'files to include'/'files to exclude'.

data.title: code folding stops at compiler directive in col 0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:41:29.513Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:

when using `#region/#endregion`, folding stops if another compiler directive is in col 0.

```
#region Utility functions
    // code here
#if SOME_SWITCH
    // do something
#endif  //SOME_SWITCH
#endregion Utility functions
```

should show this:

```
#region Utility functions-
#endregion Utility functions
```

instead it shows this:

```
#region Utility functions
#if SOME_SWITCH
    // do something
#endif
#endregion Utility functions
```

indenting the `#if` produces the desired result.

data.title: AutoSave not consistently syncing changes to Markdown files saved to OneDrive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

I discovered this issue when I opened a file on a second computer and the most recent changes, which were large and important, were not visible. They were still visible on my first computer, where I still had the file open in VSCode.

Note: After I disabled extensions (including vscode-icons and Spelling and Grammar Checker), autoSave seemed to be correctly. But for now I am still hesitant to trust VSCode to autoSave changes.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable autoSave in Workspace settings. I use `"files.autoSave": "afterDelay",`and 
   `"files.autoSaveDelay": 10,`
2. Create new and save with a .md extension to OneDrive
3. Edit file. File changes should be synced automatically to OneDrive given that autoSave is enabled. Open the file on onedrive.com to check if the edits have been synced.

data.title: Feature request: Reveal in explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

When my user settings are set to have explorer.autoReveal = false, I can't find any way to reveal a file (either from the editor list or the tab) in the built in explorer. There is a "reveal in explorer" context menu option when right clicking on a file in the list of open editors, but it opens a windows explorer window. 

I'd like suggest changing the existing "reveal in explorer" option to have the same behavior as the "autoReveal"....selecting the file in the built in explorer window under the open editors. And perhaps renaming the existing "reveal in explorer" functionality to "open in explorer".

Thanks.

data.title: Extensions icons missing in 1.4 on OS X Mavericks
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.4.0 6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679 (same issue in insider's build as of posting date). - OS Version: OS X 10.9.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Update from 1.3 or inferior 2. Open the Extensions panel, icons are gone, as shown on the attached image: The expected result would be what's displayed on the home page of https://code.visualstudio.com, which is the look and feel of 1.3: Also, the size of the text in the side panel has changed in 1.4, which makes it harder to navigate into large directories. At least having the option to set it in the preferences would be appreciated.

data.title: Integrated Terminal (PowerShell) - The handle is invalid
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise 1511

Steps to Reproduce:
Required PowerShell Module: AzureRm
1. View -> Integrated Terminal (PowerShell) -> Login-AzureRmAccount

Error:

```
Login-AzureRmAccount : The handle is invalid
At line:1 char:1
+ Login-AzureRmAccount
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : CloseError: (:) [Add-AzureRmAccount], AadAuthenticationFailedException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : Microsoft.Azure.Commands.Profile.AddAzureRMAccountCommand
```

Thanks,
Lyon Till

data.title: tmTheme bold fontStyle is not supported
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.5.0-insider (11ffcfcf69608c07e7db4b4c77856854d5083497, 2016-08-16T06:12:46.372Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-34-generic, Ubuntu 16.04

Scopes with bold `fontStyle` do not appear bolded in vscode.

``` xml
        <dict>
            <key>name</key>
            <string>Keyword</string>
            <key>scope</key>
            <string>keyword</string>
            <key>settings</key>
            <dict>
                <key>fontStyle</key>
                <string> bold</string>
                <key>foreground</key>
                <string>#d7503c</string>
            </dict>
        </dict>
```

data.title: Feature request: Better C# syntax colorizer
data.body: On latest Insiders (`1.5.0-55168276e4c0b6ec2404ac20af04eeed5f5b1000`), C# syntax highlighting look _very_ bland. As you can see, almost 70% of the text is just plain white, with only a few keyword being blue. Tried different themes as well, and all of them colorize the same bits leaving what was white-ish in the default theme intact. Am I doing something wrong? Is there an extension of sorts for enhancing this? I am new to C# in general, so perhaps this is to be expected? Or are there plans to support better syntax highlighting in the future?
